class app.api.follow.models.FollowCommandFactory

Bases: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelMixin

Abstraction allowing a Follow Model to inherit a suite of related commands

__abstract__ = True
classmethod create_follow(cls: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType, *_, **kwargs) → dict

The create_follow function creates a follow relationship between two users. It takes in the following parameters:

  • user_id - The id of the user who is being followed.

  • follower_id - The id of the user who is doing the following.

If both ids are valid, it creates a new follow object and adds it to our database session, then commits that session to our database.

Parameters

  • *_ –

    Used to Pass a variable number of arguments to a function.

  • **kwargs –

    Used to Capture any additional keyword arguments that may be passed to the function.

Returns

dict containing the query result and a success bool

classmethod delete_follow(cls: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType, **kwargs) → dict

The delete_follow function deletes a follow from the database. It takes in a dictionary of parameters and uses them to delete the follow from the database. If no such follow exists, it returns an error message.

Parameters

follow_id – UUID of the follow object

Returns

A dictionary with a key of “success” and.

classmethod get_followers(cls: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType, user_id)

The get_followers function accepts a user_id as an argument and returns the list of followers for that user.

Parameters

  • cls:ModelType – Used to Specify the model class that will be used to query the database.

  • user_id – Used to Specify the user for which to retrieve followers.

Returns

A list of followers for a user.

classmethod get_following(cls: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType, user_id)

The get_following function accepts a user_id as an argument and returns the list of users that user is following.

Parameters

user_id – Used to Specify the user for which to retrieve followers.

Returns

A list of the followers of a user.

app.api.follow.models.get_queries(user_id: str, user: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType)

The get_queries function returns a dictionary of queries that will be used to determine whether or not the user is following another user. The function takes in two parameters, the first being a string representing the id of the current user and the second being an instance of User model type. It then returns a dictionary with two keys: following_count and follower_count. Following count represents how many users are following the current user while follower count represents how many users are followed by this particular user.

Parameters

  • user_id:str – Used to Check if the user is following someone.

  • user:ModelType – Used to Access the user’s id and username.

Returns

A list of queries.
